newsitem.title: USA: S. Carolina couple jailed for beating boy.
newsitem.headline: S. Carolina couple jailed for beating boy.

text.p: A white couple was sentenced to two years in prison on Monday for beating a 10-year-old black boy.
Benjamin and Betty Mims were taken to prison shortly after the sentencing on Monday morning.

A jury found them guilty on Nov. 22 of assault and battery against Dwight Miller but not guilty on a lynching charge. The boy survived the beating and had testified in court about it. The couple had pleaded not guilty to all the charges.
Residents of this central South Carolina county, a mainly rural area, crowded into the courtroom at the Clarendon County Courthouse for the sentencing.
Security was tight, reflecting the racial tension that has divided the community since the Mimses were charged with lynching and beating Dwight last January.

Although some residents expressed concern that the Mimses were given a lenient sentence, there were no outbursts when Circuit Court Judge Thomas Cooper announced his decision. The couple could have been sentenced to 10 years in prison on the assault conviction.
Dwight testified that the Mimses accused him of stealing, then drove him into the woods where they tied him to a tree, beat him and fired a shotgun at him.
Mrs. Mims, 44, testified she did not hurt the child and said the charges "ruined my life".
Her husband, Benjamin Mims, 63, said he never saw the boy at his house that day.
